result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph Earl Phalen

records.addlTxt:
2:39 PM Defendant Joseph Earl Phalen in court.  Attorney Daniel G. Mitchell in court for Joseph Earl Phalen.  Attorney Brian Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued. 
Court informs the parties that if the Preliminary Hearing is contested that the parties will need to set this with the assigned Judge on a date other than the Preliminary Hearing dates. 

Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Adjourned initial appearance on October 24, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of $1000.00

2:46 PM Defendant Joseph Earl Phalen not in court.  Attorney Daniel G. Mitchell not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
State requests warrant for Defendant failing to appear for Court. 
Court questions the State for proper service. 
State informs the Court there was proper service. 
Court reviews the criminal complaint for probable cause. 
Court finds there is probable cause and grants the request for warrant.

BY THE COURT:
*  Warrant with $ 500 cash alternative
Signature bond if forfeited
Adjourned initial appearance on September 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Matter set for an AIA on 09/19/2022 at 2:00 p.m.

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Defendant to provide an updated address with in 48 hours to the Clerk of Court.

2:10 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joseph Earl Phalen in court. 
Court questions the defendant.
Defendant states he has not received the complaint.
ADA Pfeil provides a copy.
Defendant states he had received it before.
Defendant waives the reading of the complaint.
Court reads the penalties.
BY THE COURT: Defendant is to go to the Public Defender office today after court.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 6, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
